description: Long-Term Secular Trend – Since the advent of modern tourism in the 1950’s, international travel has grown 57-fold, as measured by international arrivals data. Global Opportunity – Many of the largest U.S.-based hotel chains and lodging choices have an overseas presence to capture potential new revenue streams. Also, global travel and tourism has contributed over 9.1% to global GDP.1 Benefit of ETF Structure – ETFs offer benefits including tax efficiency, transparency, intraday liquidity, risk management and the ability to use limit orders. Pent-Up Demand – As we move past COVID, 88% of U.S. consumers are ready to return to travel, both for business and leisure.2
name: AdvisorShares Hotel ETF
